references.reason: This paper introduces the Segment Anything Model (SAM), a foundational model for image segmentation that is extensively used and adapted in this work for generating unlearnable examples.

references.paper_title: Unlearnable examples: Making personal data unexploitable
references.reason: This is the seminal paper introducing the concept of unlearnable examples and the core methodology this paper builds upon, adapting it to the more complex task of image segmentation.

references.paper_title: Masked autoencoders are scalable vision learners
references.reason: This paper introduces the Masked Autoencoder (MAE) framework, which is used for pre-training the surrogate model in this work, highlighting its importance in the methodology.

references.paper_title: Deeplab: Semantic image segmentation with deep convolutional nets, atrous convolution, and fully connected crfs
references.reason: DeepLab is a highly influential image segmentation model used as a baseline for comparison in evaluating the effectiveness of the proposed UnSeg framework.

references.paper_title: Fully convolutional networks for semantic segmentation
references.reason: This is another highly influential image segmentation paper that provides the foundation upon which many modern segmentation networks are built, and hence, it serves as an important baseline for comparison in this paper.
